questiontext.text: A pregnant woman with G2P1 at 14 weeks of gestation, post-cesarean section 2 years ago, with laboratory tests for blood type A rhesus negative and her husband's blood type B Rhesus positive. The right treatment for this case is

answer.text: immediately give  anti-D immunoglobulin
Give anti Dimmunoglobulin at gestational age at 20-28 weeks

Give anti D immunoglobulin at 28-34 weeks

 

 weeks
Give anti D immunoglobulin during labor
Postpone anti-D immunoglobulin until the baby is born and the rhesus type is confirmed

questiontext.text: Events that can cause irritation in pregnant women with negative rhesus are:

answer.text: Administration of aspirin therapy in first trimester
Clamping of the umbilical cord near the side of the fetus
Active management at stage 3
Rhogam injection shortly after the baby is born

questiontext.text: A 39-year-old G1P0 at 39 weeks gestational age is sent to labor and delivery from her obstetrician’s office because of a blood pressure reading of 150/100 obtained during a routine OB visit. Her baseline blood pressures during the pregnancy were 100–120/60–70. On arrival to labor and delivery, the patient denies any headache, visual changes, nausea, vomiting, or abdominal pain. The heart rate strip is reactive and the tocodynamometer indicates irregular uterine contractions. The patient’s cervix is favour. Her repeat BP is 160/90. Hematocrit is 34.0, platelets are 160,000, SGOT is 22, SGPT is 15, and urinalysis is negative for protein. While a patient is being monitored, she rings the bell for the nurse because she is developing a headache and feels dizzy. As you and the nurse enter the room, you witness the patient undergoing a tonic-clonic seizure. You secure the patient’s airway and give oxygenation, and within a few minutes the seizure is over. The patient’s blood pressure monitor indicates a pressure of 160/110. You glance over at the fetal heart rate tracing and notice a bradycardia down to the sixties. The first next step to treat the patient is

answer.text: Plan for induction of labor with amniotomy and Oxytocin
Prepare for an emergent cesarean section because the patient is eclamptic
Lower the patient’s blood pressure with Nifedipine
Begin magnesium sulfate intravenously to prevent recurrent seizures

questiontext.text: Which is true of Hepatitis B in pregnancy?

answer.text: Breastfeeding is always contraindicated in women who are chronic carriers of HBV.
Non-immune mothers should not be vaccinated after the second trimester.
The risk of fetal infection is higher if maternal infection occurs in the third trimester.
Only infants with HBV positive mothers should be vaccinated.

questiontext.text: A 25 year old nulliparous patient with HIV wishes to become pregnant. Which of the following is true?

answer.text: Even with appropriate antiretroviral therapy, neonatal infection occurs 20-25% of the time.
With appropriate antiretroviral therapy, breastfeeding is safe in these patients.
the couple, particularly the women, fully understand the risks and consequences of pregnancy, childbirth and child care as well as the agreement / consent of the family

questiontext.text: A 19 year old primigravida comes into triage at 34 wks gestation with premature rupture of membranes, and no uterine contraction since more than 6 hours ago. She has received limited prenatal care. What should your next step be?

answer.text: Rectovaginal  swab and culture, and prophylactic penicillin or erythromycin
CS to avoid exposing the fetus to unknown vaginal flora
IV Clindamycin 9mg every 8 hours until delivery
GBS status does not play a role at this time
Because no history of GBS status, metronidzole is the right choice

questiontext.text: Which are typical of congenital rubella syndrome?
Higher risk for CMV infection during pregnancy

answer.text: working as a baby sitter or school teacher of kindergarten

questiontext.text: A 28-year-old G4P2103 at 31–2/7 weeks’ gestation presents to your office complaining of leakage of clear fluid from the vagina. She denies abdominal pain or vaginal bleeding. On sterile speculum exam, you confirm the presence of amniotic fluid and the cervix appears closed. Which of the following represents the most appropriate management option?

answer.text: Discharge home with a follow-up visit in a clinic in 24–48 hours
Discharge home only if the ultrasound examination shows a normal amniotic fluid volume
Admission for augmentation of labor
Admission for antibiotics and antenatal corticosteroids
Admission for cesarean section for breech presentation

questiontext.text: Perempuan, 34 tahun, G4P2A1, hamil 16 minggu, datang ke dokter praktek SpOG dengan rujukan dari puskesmas. Pada kehamilan pertama, riwayat bayi lahir dengan ikterus sempat difototerapi, hamil bayi ke-2 meninggal dalam rahim umur 28 minggu dengan hasil USG terlampir. Pemeriksaan yang perlu dilakukan adalah
Terapi untuk kasus di atas

answer.text: Rhesus imunoglobulin setelah 72 jam persalinan
Penyuntikan vaksin antigen d
Penyuntikan vaksin antibodi d pada umur 13 minggu
Penyuntikan Rhesus imunoglobulin pada minggu ke 28 kehamilan

questiontext.text: Informasi tambahan, Ibu adalah warga negara Jerman yang menikah dengan WNI. Golongan darah ibu A(-), golongan darah suami O(+). Penyebab terjadinya kasus di atas

answer.text: Terbentuknya antibodi D terhadap darah janin
Terbentuknya antigen D terhadap darah janin
terbentuknya antibodi janin Rh(+) terhadap rhesus negatif ibu
Tubuh Ibu menghasilkan antibodi terhadap Rh (+) yang menghancurkan sel darah merah janin
Terjadinya aglutinasi gol darah A dan O

questiontext.text: Seorang perempuan, 25 tahun, G1P0A0, terlambat haid 2 minggu dengan hasil uji kehamilan urin positif, datang ke poliklinik untuk pemeriksaan kehamilan pertama. Kedua orangtua pasien menderita hipertensi dan diabetes mellitus, dan saudara perempuan pasien mengalami kematian bayi setelah satu hari kelahiran. Saat ini ibu tidak ada keluhan dan cemas dengan kehamilannya. Pemeriksaan tanda fisik: tanda vital dalam batas normal, tinggi fundus uteri belum teraba. Kapan dilakukan skrining Diabetes Mellitus pada kasus ini?

Seorang perempuan, 25 tahun, G1P0A0, terlambat haid 2 minggu dengan hasil uji kehamilan urin positif, datang ke poliklinik untuk pemeriksaan kehamilan pertama. Kedua orangtua pasien menderita hipertensi dan diabetes mellitus, dan saudara perempuan pasien mengalami kematian bayi setelah satu hari kelahiran. Saat ini ibu tidak ada keluhan dan cemas dengan kehamilannya. Pemeriksaan tanda fisik: tanda vital dalam batas normal, tinggi fundus uteri belum teraba. Ibu bertanya tentang risiko kematian janin pada penderita Diabetes. Penjelasan apakah yang dapat diberikan kepada pasien?

answer.text: Resistensi insulin menghambat sinstesis surfaktan janin sehingga pematangan paru janin terlambat
Placental lactogen menghambat sinstesis surfaktan janin sehingga pematangan paru janin terlambat
Hiperglikemia menghambat sinstesis surfaktan janin sehingga pematangan paru janin terlambat
Progesteron menghambat sinstesis surfaktan janin sehingga pematangan paru janin terlambat
Hiperplasia sel β pankreas janin menghambat sinstesis surfaktan janin sehingga pematangan paru janin terlambat

questiontext.text: Seorang perempuan, 25 tahun, G1P0A0, terlambat haid 2 minggu dengan hasil uji kehamilan urin positif, datang ke poliklinik untuk pemeriksaan kehamilan pertama. Kedua orangtua pasien menderita hipertensi dan diabetes mellitus, dan saudara perempuan pasien mengalami kematian bayi setelah satu hari kelahiran. Saat ini ibu tidak ada keluhan dan cemas dengan kehamilannya. Pemeriksaan tanda fisik: tanda vital dalam batas normal, tinggi fundus uteri belum teraba. Berdasarkan penggolongan faktor risiko, pasien ini masuk dalam kategori apa?

Seorang perempuan, 25 tahun, G1P0A0, terlambat haid 2 minggu dengan hasil uji kehamilan urin positif, datang ke poliklinik untuk pemeriksaan kehamilan pertama. Kedua orangtua pasien menderita hipertensi dan diabetes mellitus, dan saudara perempuan pasien mengalami kematian bayi setelah satu hari kelahiran. Saat ini ibu tidak ada keluhan dan cemas dengan kehamilannya. Pemeriksaan tanda fisik: tanda vital dalam batas normal, tinggi fundus uteri belum teraba. Pemeriksaan apakah yang perlu dilakukan pada pasien ini?
Apakah batasan Diabetes Gestasional?

answer.text: Ketergantungan insulin yang pertama kali ditemukan pada masa kehamilan
Intoleransi karbohidrat yang pertama kali ditemukan sebelum kehamilan
Intoleransi karbohidrat yang pertama kali ditemukan pada masa kehamilan

questiontext.text: Conjoint twins :
Twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome :
Monoamniotic, dichorionic placentae

A 29 year old G2P1 at 28 weeks gestation, who had normal hemoglobin level 4 weeks ago at her first prenatal visit complains of 1 week of fatique and now has hemoglobin level of 7,0 g/dL She noted dark colored urine after taking an antibiotic for urinary tract infection. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis ?

A 25 year old patient tell her doctor that she wants to have a child in the next few year. She is concerned as she has seizure disorder and taken valproic acid. It has been 1 year since her last seizure and she has heard that seizures are dangerous for the fetus. 2. Which of the following antiseizure medication, when taken as monotherapy, is associated with the highest of major congenital malformation ?
How do circulating TSH levels change during pregnancy?

In the surgery you see a woman in her first pregnancy who is suffering from hyperemesis. You do not think that she needs admitting to hospital and prescribe an anti-emetic. Her teeth are in poor condition.Select the main reason for suggesting that she makes an appointment with a dentist:

answer.text: Hyperemesis can result in damage to maternal teeth
Periodontitis is a risk factor for low birth weight
Pregnant women are entitled to free dental care
The immune response to plaque bacteria is altered in pregnancy
There is an association between pregnancy and gingival hyperplasia

questiontext.text: A 28-year-old white woman comes to your clinic for prenatal care reporting a new-onset severe headache. She is currently pregnant with twins at an estimated gestational age of 22 weeks. Her obstetric history is significant for one previous term singleton vaginal delivery at 24 years of age without complications; she has had no other pregnan- cies. You use a manual sphygmomanometer on her left arm while she is seated and find that her blood pressure is 154/86 mm Hg. She has no history of elevated blood pressure, and her body mass index is 24 kg per m2. Based on the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) recommendation statement, which one of the following statements about the diagnosis of pre- eclampsia in this patient is accurate?

answer.text: You should use a validated risk prediction tool, such as the uterine artery pulsatility index, to diagnose preeclampsia.
You can diagnose preeclampsia only after re- peated elevated blood pressure measurements combined with certain associated signs, symp- toms, or laboratory results.
You can diagnose preeclampsia only after the detection of elevated urine protein.
You cannot diagnose preeclampsia yet because the patient’s gestational age is less than 24 weeks.
You should confirm the diagnosis of preeclamp- sia immediately by taking another blood pressure measurement in the upper arm with the patient in the left lateral position.

questiontext.text: A 28-year-old white woman comes to your clinic for prenatal care reporting a new-onset severe headache. She is currently pregnant with twins at an estimated gestational age of 22 weeks. Her obstetric history is significant for one previous term singleton vaginal delivery at 24 years of age without complications; she has had no other pregnan- cies. You use a manual sphygmomanometer on her left arm while she is seated and find that her blood pressure is 154/86 mm Hg. She has no history of elevated blood pressure, and her body mass index is 24 kg per m2. You take another blood pressure measurement during the same visit using appropriate technique and find that it has decreased to 118/74 mm Hg. She has no protein in her urine. Which of the following are the most appropriate next steps for this patient?

answer.text: Recommend that she take daily low-dose aspirin to decrease the risk of preeclampsia, preterm birth, and intrauterine growth restriction.
At subsequent prenatal visits, screen for pre- eclampsia with urine protein testing, not blood pressure measurement.
No need to monitor her blood pressure at every prenatal visit.
Prescribe an antihypertensive medication to decrease her blood pressure.

questiontext.text: A 29-year-old 1Po woman at 39 weeks' gestation deliverd vaginally. Her placenta does not deliver easily. A manual extraction of the placenta is attemped and the palcenta seems to be adherent to the uterus. A hysterectomy is contemplated, but the patient refuses due to strongly desiring more children. The cord is ligated with suture as high as possible. The patient is given the option of methotrexate therapy. Which of the following is the most complication after this intervention?

A 28-year-old G2 para 1 at 28 weeks’ gestation attends the antenatal clinicto discuss vaginal birth a er caesarean section (VBAC). She had a previous emergency caesarean section 3 years ago for undiagnosed breech in labour. Which one of the following is true concerning VBAC?

answer.text: It is contraindicated in women with previous classical caesarean section.
chances of successful vaginal birth is around 50%.

questiontext.text: A monochorionic twin pregnancy showed a discordant crown–lump length (CRL) at 12 weeks gestation, and a discordant amniotic fluid volume at 15 weeks with a deepest vertical pocket of 1.8 cm in the smaller twin and 6.3 cm in the larger twin. Both bladders are visible. Which of the following is/are likely diagnosis(es)?

answer.text: Twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome Quintero Stage II.
Complicated monochorionic twin pregnancy, suspected to develop either selective fetal growth restriction or twin–twin transfusion syndrome (TTTS).
Velamentous cord insertion in one twin.

questiontext.text: Pada usia kehamilan berapakan lambung janin sudah mulai terisi dan terdeteksi pada saat pemeriksaan USG?
Structural abnormalities identifiable as part of antenatal care – which of the following is true?

answer.text: Preconceptual folic acid supplementation for 3 months (1 mg/day) reduces the incidence of hydrocephaly and should be taken by all women considering pregnancy.
Diaphragmatic hernias rarely result in the fetus having pulmonary hypoplasia.

questiontext.text: The most important reason that administration of ergometrine to control postpartum haemorrhage is contraindicated in a woman with pre- eclampsia is:

answer.text: It is likely to make her vomit profusely
It does not work as well as oxytocin
It gives a sustained effect rather than a quick onset of action
It is likely to increase her blood pressure

questiontext.text: What of the following is part of rouitine mid trimesters scan ?
Intakes of vitamin A during pregnancy have not been associated with birth defects when it is given in doses ?
The following antihypertensive agents are used in pregnancy except:

A 30-year-old G3P2 presents for prenatal care. Her prior pregnancies have both been complicated by mild gestational hypertension near term. She is currently 12 weeks pregnant, and her blood pressure is 146/88 mm Hg. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in her management?

Perempuan, 22 tahun, G1P0A0, usia kehamilan 36-37 minggu, datang ke Puskesmas dengan keluhan demam, sakit kepala dan malaise. Riwayat luka di vagina sejak 6 minggu lalu, tidak nyeri. Pemeriksaan fisik : ruam kulit papula-skuomosa di telapak tangan dan telapak kaki, papul mengalami ulkus dengan dasar ulkus bersih di vagina, teraba pembesaran kelenjar inguinal bilateral. Apa etiologi kasus ini?

Perempuan, 22 tahun, G1P0A0, usia kehamilan 36-37 minggu, datang ke Puskesmas dengan keluhan demam, sakit kepala dan malaise. Riwayat luka di vagina sejak 6 minggu lalu, tidak nyeri. Pemeriksaan fisik : ruam kulit papula-skuomosa di telapak tangan dan telapak kaki, papul mengalami ulkus dengan dasar ulkus bersih di vagina, teraba pembesaran kelenjar inguinal bilateral. Apakah antibiotik paling tepat untuk kasus ini?
Which of the following sonographic assessments of fetal-growth restriction is the most predictive of obstetrical outcome?

answer.text:
Biometric growth < 3rd percentile and abnormal

umbilical artery Doppler velocimetry results

Biometric growth < 5th percentile and absent

end-diastolic flow noted during umbilical artery

Doppler velocimetry study

questiontext.text: A 28-year-old G2P0 at 39 weeks is in early labor. She is 2 cm dilated and 90 degree effaced, with contractions every 4 to 5 minutes. The metal heart tones are reassuring. Her nurse steps out for a moment and returns to find her having a seizure. The nurse administers a 4g magnesium bolus. The seizure stops. The fetal heart tone variability is flat, but there are no decelerations. What would your next therapies be aimed at ?

answer.text: giving hypotensive agents until the blood pressure is 110/70 mmHg
keeping the patient free of convulsions, coma, and acidosis

questiontext.text: A 28-year-old G2P0 at 39 weeks is in early labor. She is 2 cm dilated and 90 degree effaced, with contractions every 4 to 5 minutes. The metal heart tones are reassuring. Her nurse steps out for a moment and returns to find her having a seizure. This patient and other women with severe preeclampsia, when compared with pregnant women without preeclampsia, will have a decrease in which of the following ?
Of the following, which is the most common cause of death from eclampsia ?

You are seeing a patient for preconception counselling. She has complex cardiovascular problems for which she will be seeing the cardiologist next week, She is concerned that her cardiac disease may lead to cyanosis. Which cardiac diagnosis exempts her from that complications ?
Asthma is a chronic respiratory disease. In pregnancy it is associated with which of the following ?

answer.text: higher incidence of poor maternal weight gain
development of gestational diabetes secondary diabetes secondary to inhaled steroids

questiontext.text: A 34-year-old woman with long-standing systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) is pregnant for the first time. You are seeing her at 10 weeks' gestation. Special testing will be required for her during pregnancy because of marginal renal function secondary to the severity of her disease. Recommendations for management include which of the following ?

answer.text: serial ANA titers to follow the course of her disease
modified bedrest to decrease the risk of developing
serial complete blood counts to evaluate platelet counts regular ultrasounds for fetal growth

questiontext.text: Which of the following are descriptive characteristics of the fetal baseline heart rate
How is the fetal heart rate baseline determined ?

answer.text: minimun duration needed in a 10-minute period is 5 minutes

questiontext.text: Your patient has microcytic anemia with a haemoglobin of 9 and normal iron stores. What is the most likely diagnosis ?
The components of a biophysical profile include all except which of the following ?
What is the single most reliable sign of fetal compomise ?
